snippet: New York City has introduced a searchable database for the impoverished dead who have been buried on Hart Island.
abstract: Francis X Clines The City Life column highlights noteworthy attempts to pierce the anonymity surrounding the identities and lives of the unclaimed, impoverished dead who have ben interred on Hart Island, off the coast of the Bronx, since 1869.
lead_paragraph: New York City has introduced a searchable database for the impoverished dead who have been buried on Hart Island.

headline.main: Piercing the Mystery of Potter’s Field
headline.print_headline: Piercing the Mystery of Potter’s Field
